column5: Hoping somebody knows this lake and can tell me what kind of fish there would be in there.  Just moved up to North Bay, last June and have yet to locate some nice fishing holes...other than the super busy Nipissing and Trout Lake.
try the hydro pond in Powassan,lots of pike and walleye.
Where is that? I'm heading up June 19th in that area. Tried to Google hydro pond in Powassan, but no go.  Guess I can ask the locals when I stop in.

It is a man made reservoir on the south river just outside powassan. It has a day use beach area. The lake itself has alot of flooded timber. Just ask at the Bait/tackle store in Powassan(the name escapes me right now) they will point you in the right direction.
Four mile lake has lots of little pike in it. Nothing too big but you can find the odd 3-4 pounders. I think maybe some smallmouth too. Also lots of rock bass.
Tackle store is Brushy's.  Pond is on the south side of 534, just west of hwy 11.  At least i think that's what bowslayer's referring to.
